website_summaries.verdict: The best near pro-level digital camera Panasonic offers for more advanced shooters.
pros: Built-in five-axis stabilizer steadies shots without relying on lens image stabilization
Dual SD card slots make it easy to swap SD cards for continuous shooting
cons: Lack of built-in lens will require additional purchases later on for different shooting situations

customer_reviews.title: Fast autofocus!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Olympus OMD EM-5 and was looking to upgrade based on some of the features and early reviews about fast auto-focus and the 4K video. I haven't used the camera a ton yet, but did take a number of photos and videos of my son playing basketball and baseball. The ability to select stills from a 6K or 4K video is really cool. Autofocus is fast when you use Panasonic lenses. It didn't perform as well with the Olympus 75mm, but I need to do more testing this upcoming week.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Techie

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, very fast, light weight. Just add some good glass. Awesome images.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: ... came out in January of 2018 I have thoroughly enjoyed using. I still own GH5 and loved it ...
customer_reviews.text: after using this camera since it first came out in January of 2018 I have thoroughly enjoyed using for birding. I still own GH5 and loved it taking stills, but G9 is much better in taking stills. Positives are: It has EVERY possible features in a camera and did not spare any, ergo, fps, large eva, quick focus, rugged, sharpness ... etc. Initially I did not like the sensitive touch of the shutter, but I love it now
customer_reviews.author: DanSO

customer_reviews.title: Camera & Lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the G9 and Panasonic 200mm f2.8 lens. Very happy with them the photo was taken at about 100 yards distance with the 1.4 multiplier on the 200 lens. The photo was taken in raw and it was dehazed in Lightroom. Long distance tend to create a haze. Same combination but used as a macro lens, as one can see the detail on the houseflies is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barrera

customer_reviews.title: A great Wildlife camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a flagship of the Panasonic LUMIX line. The G9 has out done itself as far a quality of the photos, it has features to setup your own style of photo shooting. It is designed with the photographer in mind, it is capable of taking a bursts, preburst, and 4/6K photos, it also have video which takes 4K as well as 6K. I recommend this camera for any wildlife shooting
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 4.5 stars. Like so many camera stoday, its menu systems needs to be vastly simplified. I also believe this camera, for that matter all cameras, are overpriced. The DC 9's autofocus is excellent as is the image quality and stabilization. I have had both the OMD EM I Mk. II and now the DC 9, one can't go wrong with either one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas V. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant camera
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a lot of portraits, and the face/eye detection focusing mode is fantastic. There is nothing about the camera I don't like. When the Nikon Z6 came out, I bought one. After using it for a week, I sent it back, preferring to keep the G9. Don't be put off by the smaller sensor, in the real world, where most images end up on the internet or max 10x8 prints, there is no discernible difference in image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Durability, Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've seen several reveiws, and most indicate as a good camera, for me this camera is excellent, supplies everything I need, especially for 4K 60p video, (even with 10 Minutes limit) but the other video options go up to 30 Minutes . if you are looking for a longer time of video recording your best option is Panasonic GH5. But I tell you, that $ 300.00 less than Panasonic G9 is enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: ENSA

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: There is only one thing that could improve the G9 and that would be to have an unlimited recording time for 1080P video... It is otherwise the best hybrid camera available in the crop sensor market... And I will argue that for event photography, adventure, travel and general stills photography, wildlife AND action (UNLESS you are cropping your images to a file size below 8MP AND THEN printing larger than 8"x10") - then I will absolutely confirm that this is the best camera system OF ALL CAMERAS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Matthew Grant

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Nikon,Olympus, Pentax, Fuji and Canon. This is by far my favorite! The build is solid, the features are myriad and the IQ is excellent! It’s primarily a stills camera but has great video quality. The sensor is the same as the GH5, the IBIS is super steady and is very low light capable for a small sensor. This is the top of the MFT group!
customer_reviews.author: sjaz556

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: If you are staying outside of the U.S., do not buy this camera as you will face many issues from product registration to features you cannot access to (even wireless connection to other devices via panasonic image app). Buy from your local store to be safe from all the problems.
customer_reviews.author: A. R.

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: It is certainly lighter than a full frame camera, which was my primary requirement. Lots of hiking, etc, where anything heavier would not be practical. Even with a 100-400 tele it is reasonable weight. Image quality is as good as I could expect, configuration is reasonably easy and very very complete, and lots of features that may not be needed every day but make the camera an excellent long term investment.
customer_reviews.author: netman

customer_reviews.title: Smallsize is convenient
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice camera, quick focus and sharp images. Its much smaller and lighter than my Nikon D7100 which I also use. The negative is that the viewfinder is significantly inferior to an optical viewfinder. I have difficulty finding small birds in foliage which can be easily seen with my other cameras optical viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: A really really well made camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my existing M43 body. When combined with a Pana-Leica lens, the pictures taken are simply superb. The camera system, menu and customization helped me in taking good photos. LVF is simply marvelous and so much clearer with so much details in it. Highly recommended for those who are into still photography.
customer_reviews.author: John Liew

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my husband, he’s an amateur food photographer. It was a HUGE upgrade from the Lumix G7 he was using before. This camera is a BEAST. The biggest “bang for your buck,” in the mid-tier camera world if you’re into shooting with a Micro 4/3 sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as the gh5s.
customer_reviews.text: Poor focus with various lenses and stabilization for video is worse then not using stabilization and stabilizing in post. After installing the paid upgrade for vlog video playback freezes the camera
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good value camera.
customer_reviews.text: Good hybrid camera for 1.2k. 4k video 60 fps. It has a ton of features that I don't even use for everyday shooting.
customer_reviews.author: dimxum

customer_reviews.title: Great buy very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected . A professional camera with all the settings I could imagine. Great photos looking forward to learning more and growing with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Wpwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. The image quality is fantastic with my main lens (12-60mm f/2.8) and now RAWs can be processed. Ergonomics are good for me. The size and feel make it comfortable to carry around and the setting dials are easy to get to for quick changes. I usually use a wrist strap (Peak Design) and find that very comfortable but I also have a neck strap when I need it (again, a Peak Design). While the camera is not too heavy I certainly don't want to take chances.
customer_reviews.author: LarryW

customer_reviews.title: My new A cam.
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this camera, great balance between photos and stills, easy powering solutions. Roboust quality and features and the photos and videos look amazing.

customer_reviews.title: Best buy at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily of the 5 axis gimble for BTS shoot for Social content. It exceeded my expectation.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best camera i have ever owned lightweight ease of use esey to learn controls highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for video and stills. This is my third LUMIX camera and probably the best one.
customer_reviews.author: Smartbob

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera came fast and showed up as described .Could not me happier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Bang for you buck
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera. Takes great photos and quality 4K video. The price for the quality is amazing. That’s why I brought 2 of them lol.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for hybrid shooting
customer_reviews.text: Takes great photos and video. I had been specifically looking for an EVF and this one is perfect. Everything comes out true to color
customer_reviews.author: Brendan C.

customer_reviews.title: Good hybird camera!
customer_reviews.text: Take very nice picture for my little one! Picture come out perfect as professional take.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Absolutely excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It has features that make me cackle like a mad scientist. In body stabilization is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Asher

customer_reviews.title: The auto focus is very good.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, it's an improve over lumix cameras that came before g9.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lightweight camera that is super fun to use. I had only ever used clunky DSLR's before like the Canon t7i and the 80d so upgrading to this was actually really great because it feels like a DSLR without all the added bulk. The improved grip is super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bashaar Shah

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, could be better...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it a week (replacing a G7), and still waiting for good weather to try it out but these are my first impressions: - FAST. Takes bursts so quick it's hard to take just one in burst mode - Good feel in the hand. Finally a place to rest my pinky. - Great EVF - Better image quality - but not by leaps and bounds - IBIS! - HiRes mode is great for still subjects. Lots of detail. - Better AF the G7. Still hunts sometimes. Holds tracking better on BIF etc. - Focus mode knob is stiff and lacks easy grip. Very hard to move with gloves on. - Top LCD goes off when camera sleeps... What?
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Brought the excitement back for me. Paired with a speed booster and a Canon 50 mm 1.4.
customer_reviews.author: Luis1v

customer_reviews.title: The body is great, lens not so much.
customer_reviews.text: 5/5 for the G9 body. One of the bigger M43 cameras no doubt, but it handles well, has amazing stabilization, makes great images (for the format). The kit 12-60mm F2.8-4.0 Lens lens however is disappointing. For a lens of that price, I expect both technical excellence and 'good enough for photos'. It's certainly good enough to create some great images, but aside from it's extra zoom range and great IS, it is not up to the standard of either my old beat up Panasonic 12-35mm F2.8 or a borrowed Olympus 12-40mm f2.8. Both of those lenses are sharper through the range, especially in the corners were the 12-60mm falls flat.
customer_reviews.author: Ross W.

customer_reviews.title: best purchase I have made
customer_reviews.text: great all around camera,grip is easy to get used to. menu is arranged in a simple,yet a clear and informative. PQ is extremely great. hassle-free when it comes to connecting to PC. And the best part for folks like me who knows nothing about digital photography ,is that all the need to do is just do the basic settings that fits your shooting environments and needs ,then shoot on auto. Sorry,not knowledgeable enough to dive in deeply,as this is my first ever D.Camera,the only camera I was using for the past 33 years was Olympus OM-4.
customer_reviews.author: GHZ

customer_reviews.title: A good compromise
customer_reviews.text: No camera is perfect for a prosumer like myself. I have a D750 and D3500. D750 is a great full frame and D3500 is great for travel. But D750 is extremely heavy and d3500 (as well as D750) lack decent video. It made no sense to me to upgrade to Z50 or z6 as both lacked video stabilization as well as 4k 60fps. G-9 was the perfect compromise. Light weight, many focus modes, excellent stabilization. It will be my new travel camera. Will keep all others due to lens collections. But for overseas travel g-9 will be my baby!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera and Great price! This is a great versatile camera. Takes great pictures and feels great in hands. Not too small and not too big. Excellent multipurpose camera. Price is a steal for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: SBE

customer_reviews.title: viewfinder hard to see in sunlight
customer_reviews.text: Great camera indoors, but impossible to view the viewfinder in sunlight. Suspect this is a common problem with digital cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K Camrea
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera it has good picture quality and can capture videos at 4K 60fps. It's worth the money, you also use it as a webcam for live streaming on platforms like Twitch and YouTube!
customer_reviews.author: William Shell

customer_reviews.title: 2019: Best Lightweight Hybrid MFT Camera
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a budget under $1,000? Try the Lumix G9. The G9 is great for both pix and 4k video. This camera offers pix over 40 megapixels and high bit rate bit video. You can't beat that. This is the perfect lightweight hybrid camera. The body typically sells for under $1k. The expensive Leica lenses are beyond reproach. The MFT format is here to stay. I've had my Lumix for a while now. I've never had a problem with quality or features. What do you want in a hybrid camera?
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Manuel Mena Garza

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomics and features.. it's still an M43
customer_reviews.text: I've owned dozens of SLRs, DSLRs(Canon) and now a few mirrorless(Sony, Canon, Panasonic). This is by far the best camera for ergonomics. 3 programmable dials, buttons galore (most programmable) great EVF, superfast frame rate with electronic shutter. I've had my 1st one for almost 3 yrs and it's very durable. Negatives: like all mirrorless, battery life is not great. Always bring one or 2 spares. Noise in images over 1200-1600 ISO. Lack of 3rd party lenses and few lens in super zoom range.
customer_reviews.author: Les Crane

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! I've had the camera for a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! I've had the camera for a few weeks now and am enjoying the camera very much. It would have been nicer if the Leica lenses were made in Germany, Canada or for that matter even Japan.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Chesrow
